title: U.S. Constitution: Article 1, Section 8, Clause 17
subtitle: The U.S. Constitution doesn't prevent the federal government from holding the title "to any real property" without state consent.
author: David Mikkelson
vclaim: Article 1, Section 8 of the U.S. Constitution holds that "the Federal Government shall never own title to any real property which is not specifically authorized by this Constitution such as parks, forests, dams, waterways, and grazing areas without the consent of the State where same is located."
